unit_learning_outcomes.description: Understand the structure, content and philosophy of the Legal Studies Syllabus.
Understand contemporary approaches to assessment and reporting relevant to the teaching of Legal Studies.

Develop the capacity to build student rapport and foster a supporting learning environment in a subject area highly dependent on discussion and the exchange of social and cultural perspectives and knowledge.
Understand contemporary approaches to teaching and learning, especially as they relate to Legal Studies.
Plan and implement lessons that feature the pedagogies typically used in the Legal Studies classroom.
Effectively manage and monitor student learning.
Recognise that the diversity of students is a valuable educational resource in the context of the Legal Studies classroom.

non_scheduled_learning_activities.description: Workshop preparation may include completing set readings, conducting research, or, compiling resources

assessments.description: Students will design a Stage appropriate assessment task with reference to the research literature and provide a pedagogical reflection underpinned by recent and relevant pedagogical and other scholarly literature. (3000 words)
This task requires students to find and annotate two recent articles related to a contemporary issue from the Legal Studies syllabus. Articles will be used to respond to an Essay question.

data.description: This unit is designed for students who plan to teach Legal Studies for years 11 and 12 but whose major teaching subject is in another area, such as Geography or History. The unit explores the aims, content and instructional demands of the NESA Legal Studies syllabus documents for Stage 6, and assists students to design innovative, student-centered units of work and to identify or develop appropriate teaching resources.
